This amendment was withdrawn due to what's called a point of order. Points of order are prohibitions against certain types of legislation or congressional actions. These prohibitions are enforced when a Rep raises a point of order against legislation that may violate these rules

Now, as we work through the Intelligence and Emerging Threats and Capabilities Subcommittee markup, we have our first individual amendment that we will consider. When individual amendments like this are proposed the full committee debates it and oftentimes votes on it.

Voice voting is the quickest way to vote on something because we don't have to tally each Rep's vote. It's typically used when there's broad consensus on a vote or issue. It is the right of any Rep to request a recorded vote even if a voice vote is proposed.
En bloc is when we bundle noncontroversial amendments together and vote on them all at once. The Chair of the subcommittee provides an overview of the en bloc package before we vote on it.
